content: Alcohol Use Disorder: DSM-5 criteria ≥2 of 11 symptoms in 12 months: tolerance, withdrawal, drinking more/longer than intended, persistent desire/failed attempts to cut down, time spent obtaining/using/recovering, craving, role impairment, continued use despite social/interpersonal problems, activities given up, use in hazardous situations, continued despite physical/psychological problems. Severity: mild 2-3, moderate 4-5, severe ≥6. Alcohol Withdrawal: 6-24h onset: tremor, anxiety, diaphoresis, N/V, headache, insomnia. 12-48h: hallucinations. 48-96h: seizures (generalized tonic-clonic). Delirium Tremens (2-5d): confusion, disorientation, autonomic instability, hallucinations - medical emergency, 5-15% mortality. CIWA-Ar score: <8 minimal, 8-15 mild-moderate, >15 severe withdrawal. Treatment: benzodiazepines (symptom-triggered or fixed-schedule), thiamine, folate, multivitamin. Complications: cirrhosis, pancreatitis, cardiomyopathy, Wernicke-Korsakoff, peripheral neuropathy.
name: Alcohol Use Disorder & Withdrawal - Criteria
